WorkItem.Description: The latest version do not read and enter or update the msi product #. I have gone back to version 1.3.1407.29 and when I create a new update the program will read the msi and enter default rules for if it is installed and can it be installed using MSI product installed and the product # from the msi file. When I create a superseding update it will take forward the rules and update with the new msi product #. The new version 1.3.1504.15 does not do either of these. When creating a new update both is installed and can be installed are blank and when creating a superseding update the old msi product # is still in the rules not the new number.
WorkItem.Summary: Version 1.3.1504.15 not reading the MSI Product number

Comments.Message:
https://wsuspackagepublisher.codeplex.com/workitem/259

Should explain the new handling.

Regards
Norbert
Thanks Norbert - I have even wondered about that. BUT when you create an "superseding Update" the MSI Code of the old Update/File is still placed in the update rules pane. That should be fixed imho.

As you can see, I send the same Input in the above item. ;)
> Maybe you can add "removing" existing msi rules at update level? But that would require some checking if there are multiple msi rules in one update in a later version.

Maybe we should open a new Feature Request...

Regards
Norbert

OK, I opened a issue on this:

Regards
